A
manifest allows for defining extensions for Tuist.
The platform type represents the platform a target is built for. It can be any of the following types.

is a wrapper around
to type the project or workspace configurations.
Contains the description of a dependency that can be installed using Carthage.
Specifies the default set of settings applied to all the projects and targets.

FileCodeGen: Soure file code generation attribues
The type
represents a set of options for a test action.
Core Data model.
Diagnostics options represent the configurable diagnostics-related settings in the schemes’ run and test actions.
Contains the description of a dependency that can be installed using Swift Package Manager.

A path represents a path to a file, directory, or a group of files represented by a glob expression. Paths can be relative and absolute. We discourage using absolute paths because they create a dependency with the environment where they are defined.
You can create a test action with either a set of test targets or test plans using the
or
static methods respectively.
Represents the device your product will support.
The type of build product.
Copy files actions, represented as target copy files build phases, are useful to associate project files
and products of other targets with the target and copies them to a specified destination, typically a
subfolder within a product. This action may be used multiple times per target.
File element
A target within a specified project. The project is specified through the path and should contain the target name.
It represents the scheme action to archive targets’ products. It’s initialized with the
static method.
Contains options for test options within autogenerated targets
Defines the target dependencies supported by Tuist
It represents the target headers.

target dependencies
It represents a glob pattern that refers to files.
Language to use in target action. Can be initialized with String which should be a valid language code or used as pre-defined pseudo language.

should be synthesized
Cloud represents the configuration to connect to the server.

action
This model allows to configure Tuist.
The target of a project
It represents a list of source files that are part of a target:
It represents a list of glob patterns that refer to files.
The list of files can be initialized with a string that represents the glob pattern, or an array of strings, which represents a list of glob patterns.
The InfoPlist model represents a target’s Info.plist file.
The
model represents the minimum operating system version your product will support.
A
defines a collection of targets to Build, Run, Test, Profile, Analyze and Archive.
A
manifest allows for defining external dependencies for Tuist.
It represents a glob pattern that refers to source files and the compiler flags (if any) to be set in the build phase:

Projects are defined in
files, which we refer to as manifest files.
Manifests need to import the framework
which contains all the values that are available for you to describe your projects.
It represents the scheme action that runs the built products on the supported platforms. It’s initialized with the .runAction static method.
A dependency of a Swift package.
A struct representing a semver version.
